conclusion: The image shows a vertical board with three release points at the top labeled A (cyan), B (orange), and C (pink). There are several baffles (angled planks) on the board, and two containers at the bottom labeled D (left, orange) and E (right, brown). The liquid will flow from A, B, and C, interact with the baffles, and eventually land in either container D or E.
An orange baffle is below A, angled downward to the right.
A white baffle is below the orange one, angled downward to the left.
A purple baffle is below the white one, angled downward to the left.
A cyan baffle is below B and C, angled downward to the left.
A yellow baffle is to the right of the cyan one, angled downward to the left.
Container D is on the left side, directly below the purple baffle.
Container E is on the right side, below the yellow baffle.

premise: Liquid from A falls straight down and hits the orange baffle directly below A, which slopes downward to the right.
conclusion: The liquid slides along the orange baffle and falls off its right end.

premise: From the right end of the orange baffle, the liquid falls straight down and hits the white baffle, which slopes downward to the left.
conclusion: The liquid slides along the white baffle and falls off its left end.

premise: From the left end of the white baffle, the liquid falls straight down and hits the purple baffle, which also slopes downward to the left.
conclusion: The liquid slides along the purple baffle and falls off its left end.

premise: From the left end of the purple baffle, the liquid falls straight down. The purple baffle’s left end is directly above container D.
conclusion: The liquid from A will land in container D.

premise: Liquid from B falls straight down and hits the cyan baffle directly below B, which slopes downward to the left.
conclusion: The liquid slides along the cyan baffle and falls off its left end.

premise: From the left end of the cyan baffle, the liquid falls straight down. The cyan baffle’s left end is positioned such that the liquid will hit the purple baffle below it, which slopes downward to the left.
conclusion: The liquid slides along the purple baffle and falls off its left end.

premise: As with the liquid from A, the purple baffle’s left end is directly above container D.
conclusion: The liquid from B will also land in container D.
